sentences.sContent: The name of the cheese is Dolcelatte, literally meaning ‘sweet milk’.
sentences.sCn: 这种奶酪名叫Dolcelatte，字面意思是 “甜牛奶” 。

sentences.sContent: I said I felt like quitting, but I didn’t mean it literally (= I did not mean exactly what I said )!
sentences.sCn: 我是说我不想干了，但并不是真的不干了！

sentences.sContent: ...It literally is like something in a dream to remember what is like to actually be able to go out and put in a day's work and receive a day's pay...
...There is literally only one job opening for every five unemployed workers...
...Because they're literally rooted into the ground...
...and there are literally hundreds of schools caught up in the fad Public schools in Wisconsin...
...It is figuratively and literally otherworldly in its aims...

words.tran: 文字的；逐字的；无夸张的
拘泥于字句；直译主义；彻底写实主义
文字，字义上；无修饰；表面意义上
拘泥于字句；照字面意义解释

trans.tranOther: according to the most basic or original meaning of a word or expression
